item.title: Jes add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "It is the time you have wasted for your rose that makes your rose so important." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Jes add a quote by Judith Minty
item.description: "I give you this to take with you: Nothing remains as it was. If you know this, you can begin again, with pure joy in the uprooting." -- Judith Minty

item.title: Jes add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "It is looking at things for a long time that ripens you and gives you a deeper meaning." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Jes add a quote by Henry Van Dyke
item.description: "Time is too slow for those who wait, too swift for those who fear, too long for those who grieve, too short for those who rejoice, but for those who love, time is eternity." -- Henry Van Dyke

item.title: Jes add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "When we love, we always strive to become better than we are. When we strive to become better than we are, everything around us becomes better too." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Jes add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "The simple things are also the most extraordinary things, and only the wise can see them." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Jes add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Jes add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Tears are words that need to be written." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Jes add a quote by Calvin Coolidge
item.description: "Nothing in the world can take the place of persistence. Talent will not; nothing is more common than unsuccessful men with talent. Genius will not; unrewarded genius is almost a proverb. Education will not; the world is full of educated derelicts. Persistence and determination alone are omnipotent. The slogan Press On! has solved and always will solve the problems of the human race." -- Calvin Coolidge

item.title: Jes add a quote by Tom Hiddleston
item.description: "You never know what's around the corner. It could be everything. Or it could be nothing. You keep putting one foot in front of the other, and then one day you look back and you've climbed a mountain." -- Tom Hiddleston

item.title: Jes add a quote by Hal Borland
item.description: "Knowing trees, I understand the meaning of patience. Knowing grass, I can appreciate persistence." -- Hal Borland

item.title: Jes add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "One can no more keep the mind from returning to an idea than the sea from returning to a shore. For a sailor, this is called the tide; in the case of the guilty it is called remorse. God stirs up the soul as well as the ocean." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Jes add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jes add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "What should I possibly have to tell you, oh venerable one? Perhaps that you're searching far too much? That in all that searching, you don't find the time for finding?" -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Jes add a quote by Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
item.description:
"I want to see you.
Know your voice.
Recognize you when you first come 'round the corner.
Sense your scent when I come into a room you've just left.
Know the lift of your heel, the glide of your foot.
Become familiar with the way you purse your lips then let them part, just the slightest bit, when I lean in to your space and kiss you.
I want to know the joy of how you whisper "more" -- Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

item.title: Jes add a quote by Joshua Slocum
item.description: "I had already found that it was not good to be alone, and so made companionship with what there was around me, sometimes with the universe and sometimes with my own insignificant self; but my books were always my friends, let fail all else." -- Joshua Slocum

item.title: Jes add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "Do stuff. be clenched, curious. Not waiting for inspiration's shove or society's kiss on your forehead. Pay attention. It's all about paying attention. attention is vitality. It connects you with others. It makes you eager. stay eager." -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Jes add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others." -- Mahatma Gandhi
